questions.text: A 22-year-old woman develops a red rash over her cheeks, and pain and swelling in both knees as well as several small joints in her hands. Medical evaluation reveals oral ulceration and 3+ proteinuria. Which of the following is the most sensitive test for the diagnosis of this condition?

A previously healthy 19-year-old female university student develops myalgia, headache, fever, and malaise. Blood tests reveal lymphocytosis, with 20% of the lymphocytes being atypical. She remains tired and unwell for 6 weeks, but repeated tests for heterophil antibody are negative. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the possible cause of irreversible dementia?
A 35 year old male patient with schizophrenia is being treated with clozapine. The patient has to undergo regular blood monitoring because of which side effect?
Which of the following is not transmitted perinatally?
A young male came with complaints of high grade fever and malaise. His peripheral smear was prepared and is shown below. Diagnosis is?

A 40-year-old male presents to the clinic with a painless, firm, subcutaneous nodule on his left shin, which has been gradually increasing in size over the past few weeks. He denies any recent trauma or insect bites. On further examination, the lesion is indurated, non-tender, and shows central ulceration with a serous discharge. There are no signs of regional lymphadenopathy. The patient has a history of unprotected sexual intercourse with multiple partners. He denies any other symptoms. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient's presentation?

A 64-year woman with Type II diabetes for 10 years now develops increasing fatigue, dyspnea, and pedal edema. On examination, her blood pressure is 165/90 mm Hg, pulse 90/min, JVP is 4 cm, heart sounds are normal, lungs are clear, and there is 3+ pedal edema. Her urinalysis is positive for 3 gm/L of protein and no casts. Which of the following renal diseases is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 62-year-old male with underlying COPD develops a viral upper respiratory infection and begins taking an over-the counter decongestant. Shortly thereafter he experiences palpitations and presents to the emergency room, where the given rhythm strip is obtained, demonstrating:
A pregnant lady is a known case of juvenile myoclonic epilepsy and is receiving sodium valproate. Which of the following drugs is best suited after valproate for management of this patient?

A 50-year-old woman is on immunosuppressive therapy with steroids post kidney transplantation. She presents with 3 day history of fever, headache and confusion. LP reveals 200 PMN cells /cu.mm with elevated CSF protein. India ink preparation slide is shown. What is the diagnosis?

A 35-year-old man presents to the emergency department for difficulty with walking. His symptoms began approximately 1 week ago and has progressively worsened. He has noticed some light-headedness with standing up from a seated position and some numbness in the bilateral lower extremities. Physical examination is notable for 4/5 power and decreased sensation to light touch and pinprick in the bilateral lower extremity and absent patellar and ankle reflexes. A lumbar puncture is performed, which demonstrates a cell count of 1/uL, protein is 135 mg/dL, and glucose is 65 mg/dL. Which of the following is not associated with the diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Autonomic dysfunction is not associated

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents with a complaint of muscle weakness that worsens with activity but improves after rest. He reports difficulty in chewing, swallowing, and speaking, particularly at the end of the day. On examination, there is bilateral ptosis and weakness of the extraocular muscles. Deep tendon reflexes are normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year old female presents with complaints of gradual Onset weakness of legs for one month with reduction in Visual acuity and urinary incontinence for past few days. Contrast MRI shows periventricular lesions. The most common ophthalmologic symptom of probable diagnosis is:
Which of the following is the earliest manifestation in the patient presenting with shown physical features?

A 27-year-old male presents with headaches, muscle weakness, and high blood pressure. A basic metabolic panel showed a Na+ of 147 and K+ of 3.1. CT of the abdomen demonstrates bilaterally adrenal hyperplasia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Transudative pleural effusion is present in all except:

A 63-year-old male from the middle east presented with hematuria. The urine showed RBCs but no RBC casts. BUN level was normal. cystoscopy revealed an irregular growth on the mucus of the bladder. A biopsy from this growth revealed features of squamous cell carcinoma. The etiology of this cogidition is most likely linked to:

A 70 years old patient benign prostatic hyperplasia underwent transurethral resection of prostate under spinal anaesthesia. One hour later, he developed vomiting and altered sensorium. The most probable cause is:

options.label: A
options.text: Over dosage of spinal aesthetic agent

questions.text: A 60 years old male presented with fever, chills and dysuria. Patient was hospitalized in emergency for 5 days. PSA level was 7.4. Next best step in this patient:

While performing a newborn checkup on a baby boy, a pediatrician discovers the external urethral orifice (urethral opening) is located on the ventral (bottom) surface of the penis, as depicted in the given illustration. What is the most likely diagnosis in this newborn?
A five years old child presents with ballooning of prepuce after micturition. Examination of penis reveals prepucial adhesions. Which of the following the best treatment:
A young man gets into a fight after taking beer and is kicked by the lower abdomen. There was pelvic fracture. Blood at meatus. Most likely cause is:
When a ‘spontaneous perforation’ of the esophagus occurs as a result of severe barotrauma while a person vomits against a closed glottis, the condition is known as:

A 36-year-old woman presents with a substantial unilateral breast enlargement. She had presumed that this was normal, but on examination, a large, firm tumor is palpated by the attending physician. There is early erosion on the skin. A favourable outlook can be anticipated if the lesion is which of the following?

A 44-year-old man comes to the emergency department with abdominal pain and nausea for the past 24 hours. The pain started a few hours after dinner, and he describes it as constant pain in the upper part of his abdomen that radiates to his back and flanks. The patient also reports nausea, intermittent vomiting, and abdominal distention. Family history is significant for recurrent episodes of pancreatitis in his father and paternal uncle. He reports drinking an average of 2 alcoholic drinks per week. His temperature is 37.7ºC (99.9ºF), pulse is 92/min, respirations are 20/min, peripheral oxygen saturation is 96%, and blood pressure is 149/94 mmHg. He appears distressed and anxious. Abdominal examination shows tenderness and rigidity over the epigastric and periumbilical regions. Bowel sounds are diminished. Bruising of the umbilicus or flanks are seen. Which of the following laboratory results is the most specific in diagnosing this patient’s condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Serum amylase > 3 times the upper limit of normal

options.label: B
options.text: Serum lipase > 3 times the upper limit of normal

questions.correct_answer: B. Serum lipase > 3 times the upper limit of normal

questions.text: A 60-year-old chronic smoker presented with progressive jaundice, pruritus and clay coloured stools for 2 months. History of waxing and waning of jaundice was present. A CT scan revealed dilated main pancreatic duct and common bile duct. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 50 years old male presented with the history of epigastric pain, anorexia, weight loss and pedal edema. On laboratory examination, total protein and albumin was low. Endoscopy was performed and the image is given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 50 years old male presents with obstructive symptoms. Biopsy of stomach reveals gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST). Most appropriate market for GIST is:
In a burn patient, the doctor is looking for curling ulcer. Which part should be examined?

options.label: D
options.text: Junction between 2nd and 3rd part of duodenum

questions.text: A 30-year-old a male patient presented with abdominal pain, fever, nausea, vomiting and respiratory distress. His BP was found to be 80/40 mm Hg and pulse rate of 115/min. The following chest X-ray was recorded in emergency. What is the immediate management?

options.label: A
options.text: IV fluids and antibiotics followed by laparotomy

questions.correct_answer: A. IV fluids and antibiotics followed by laparotomy

questions.text: On 7th post operative day, abdominal wound shows pink serosanguinous discharge. It suggests:
A young patient was brought to the emergency with colicky abdominal pain, bilious vomiting. CT findings are given below. What is the name of this sign?

A 14-year-old girl with history of prolonged fever and abdominal discomfort is observed to have splenomegaly and leucopenia. In the course of disease she developed acute abdominal event and died. Which of the following is the likely finding on autopsy?

A 65-year-old man presented with an episode of syncope. He said he felt dizzy during defecation and noticed gross bleeding in the pan. Fecal occult blood test done 3 months ago as a part of routine screening for colon cancer was negative. There is no history of recent weight loss. What is the likely colonoscopic finding?

options.label: D
options.text: Dilated mucosal and submucosal veins in the colon

questions.correct_answer: D. Dilated mucosal and submucosal veins in the colon

questions.text: Most common complication of ileostomy is:
A patient gives chronic history of diarrhoea and blood in stool presents with multiple fistulae in the perineum and multiple stricture in small intestine. The diagnosis is:
A woman was brought to the casualty 8 hours after sustaining burns on the abdomen, both the limbs and back. What will be the best formula to calculate amount of fluid to be replenished?

options.label: D
options.text: 4 mL/kg × % TBSA in first 8 hours followed by 2 mL/kg/ hour × % TBSA

questions.text: A patient of motor vehicle accident was admitted to the casualty. He does not speak but moans every now and then, eyes are closed but opens to pain, the right limb is not moving but the left limb shows movement to pain. Both the legs are in extended posture. What will be the GCS score?
A patient presented with gradually progressive painless mass since 10 years. It is firm to nodular & variable in consistency at each site. Most probable diagnosis is:
A 45 years old patient presented to you with ongoing massive hematemesis. The patient is alert and hemodynamically stable. What will be the first step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Do an urgent upper GI endoscopy

options.label: B
options.text: Put the patient in recovery position and secure airway

options.label: C
options.text: Insert a cannula and start IV fluids

questions.correct_answer: B. Put the patient in recovery position and secure airway

questions.text: Acute cellular rejection following solid organ transplantation occurs:

options.label: A
options.text: Within minutes to hours of transplantation

questions.correct_answer: C. Between 5 to 30 days of transplantation

questions.text: A patient undergoes a prolonged and complicated pancreatic surgery for chronic pancreatitis. Most preferred route for supplementary nutrition in this patient would be:
22 Gauge IV cannula color is:
According to Weigert-Meyer’s rule of duplication of ureter, the lower pole ureter in urinary bladder is:

options.label: A
options.text: Lateral and cephalad to the upper pole ureter

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral and caudal to the upper pole ureter

options.label: C
options.text: Medial and cephalad to the upper pole ureter

options.label: D
options.text: Medial and caudal to the upper pole ureter

questions.correct_answer: A. Lateral and cephalad to the upper pole ureter

questions.text: Hesselbach’s triangle is bounded by the following, except:
A lady who is 9 weeks pregnant comes with a 2.5 cm mass in the upper outer quadrant of left breast. Ultrasound failed to show any abnormality. The ideal management will be to:

options.label: C
options.text: Call patient one month after delivery

questions.text: A 40-years-old female was diagnosed with CIN-3. What will be the management?

A 30-years-old primigravida presented at 10 weeks gestation with painless, bright red bleeding per vaginum. On examination, the uterus is 12 weeks size. Ultrasonography revealed the following picture. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 65-year-old female with chronic backache revealed the following appearance on a lumbar radiograph. What is the most likely biochemical parameters associated?

options.label: A
options.text: Calcium: normal or decreased; Phosphate: increased; ALP: increased

options.label: B
options.text: Calcium: normal; Phosphate: normal; ALP: increased

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium: normal; Phosphate: normal; ALP: normal

options.label: D
options.text: Calcium: normal; Phosphate: decreased; ALP: increased

questions.correct_answer: C. Calcium: normal; Phosphate: normal; ALP: normal

questions.text: An 18-year-old rugby player has pain in ring finger after missing tackle 1week ago. On Examination: tenderness in distal palm & inability to actively flex DIP joint. Diagnosis of Jersey finger is made. Most likely ruptured structure is:
Preferred treatment option for a 4 days old baby with bilirubin of 8 mg/ dL:
What type of fracture is shown in the image?
questions.correct_answer: A. Neer’s type III proximal humerus

questions.text: A 38-year-old man was slapped over his right ear during fight. There is blood coming from his right external auditory canal. He describes pain as intense & has ringing in his ears.He is also noted to have decreased hearing on that ear. What is the most appropriate initial investigation?
A sexually active male presented with warts on his penis as shown during examination. Which of these strains of HPV is most commonly the cause of these lesions?

A 63-year-old man presents for an elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy. He is obese, has angina unpredictably and at rest, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). Which of the following would be his ASA classification?
A 3-year-old child with weight of 12 kg is having loose motions. He is thirsty, drinks eagerly, tears are absent and skin pinch goes back slowly. What is the best treatment plan for this child?

options.label: C
options.text: ORS 50 ml per episode of loose stool

options.label: D
options.text: ORS 100 ml per episode of loose stool

questions.correct_answer: D. ORS 100 ml per episode of loose stool

questions.text: A hypertensive pregnant woman at 35 weeks comes with history of pain in abdomen, bleeding per vaginum and loss of fetal movements. On examination uterus is contracted with increased uterine tone. Fetal heart sounds are absent. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 50-year-old male presents with a complaint of hearing loss in his right ear. On audiometric testing, a distinctive configuration is observed in the right ear, showing a notch or a dip at around 2,000 Hz. The hearing thresholds improve at higher frequencies. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old male presents to the emergency department with acute choking. The patient is unable to speak, cough, or breathe and appears distressed. What is the most appropriate immediate action to be taken?

options.label: D
options.text: Perform a finger sweep to clear the airway.

questions.text: A 6-year-old child presents with recurrent episodes of middle ear effusion, causing mild hearing loss and speech delay. Otoscopic examination reveals the presence of fluid behind both tympanic membranes (bilateral otitis media with effusion). What is the most appropriate initial treatment for this child’s glue ear?
questions.correct_answer: B. Myringotomy with ventilation tube insertion

questions.text: A 7-year-old child presents to the clinic with a sore throat and difficulty swallowing. On examination, the child has enlarged tonsils with white exudates, fever, and tender cervical lymph nodes. The child is diagnosed with tonsillitis. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?
Shown instrument is used for which of the following?

A 6-month-old infant presents to the emergency department with a harsh, high-pitched noise during inspiration. The infant appears agitated and is having difficulty breathing. On examination, there is audible inspiratory stridor, retractions, and nasal flaring. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the infant's symptoms?
Which of the following is not a feature of a patient presenting with shown finding on tympanic membrane?

A patient presented with glaucoma following cataract surgery, a moderate elevation of intraocular pressure that often follows replacement of crystalline lens. Which of the following is a choice for treatment and the correct mechanism for that drug?
questions.correct_answer: D. Timolol—decreased synthesis of aqueous humor

questions.text: A 30 year old smoker present to you with irritable cough and hoarseness with the history of atrophic rhinitis & pharyngitis, excessive crusts seen when you perform laryngoscopy. Laryngoscopic picture is shown in the given image. The diagnosis is?

A 22-year-boy present with complaint of nasal discharge, nasal bleeding, headache and facial pain. He has recurrent sinusitis in previous years . You examine him and see that his nasal septum is deviated . What is your next step?

A 40-year-old woman develops accelerated hypertension (blood pressure 216/106 mm Hg) but no clinical symptoms except frequent headaches. Which of the following findings are most likely on examination of the fundus examination?
A 50-year-old male presents with cicatricial entropion of upper and lower eyelid. On eversion of upper eyelid, linear conjunctival scars - Arlt's line are seen. What is the diagnosis?
A 23-year-old pregnant female presented with slowly progressive hearing loss, tinnitus and vertigo. On otoscope schwartz sign is positive. What will be the diagnosis?

A 50-year-old diabetic female complaints of nocturnal otalgia & ear discharge. There is no significant deafness or vertigo & denies any ear trauma.On examination of external ear canal, granulation is seen. What is the possible diagnosis?
An ENT specialist was trying to remove wax from the patient’s EAC and the patient started having cough. Which of these nerves is responsible for the cough:

During resuscitation of a baby who did not cry at birth, even after the initial steps, the baby did not cry. Hence positive pressure ventilation with bag and mask was started. Which of the following is the most sensitive indicator that the baby is responding?
A 7 year old child presented with complaints of hematuria with history of sore throat 2 weeks .On assessment, no fever and cola colored urine was noted. What is the diagnosis ?
Which of the following conditions is associated with hypocalcemia, TOF, thymic hypoplasia and microdeletion in chromosome 22q11.2?

A 5 months child presented with difficulty in breathing , chest indrawing and wheeze of 1 day duration. Previous episodes of wheezing/ MDI usage is present. What is the next step in management of this condition?
A 3 year child presents to Emergency Room with uprolling of eye balls and tonic posturing for last 2 minutes with peri-oral cyanosis, the initial step in management includes?

options.label: D
options.text: Get blood glucose levels, if low give IV glucose

questions.text: A 68-year-old diabetic male presents with persistent ear discharge with fever and headache. He complained of pain out of proportion. On examination, granulations and tenderness are observed on the floor of the external auditory canal along with facial nerve palsy. He is not responding to antibiotics. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A child presents with left ear hearing loss of three month duration. On examination, foul smelling purulent discharge is seen with perforation in pars flaccida. What is the most appropriate management?

options.label: A
options.text: Topical antibiotics and decongestants for 4 weeks.

questions.text: A female who underwent laproscopic appendicectomy for acute appendicitis, on post -operative day 2 bumped her nose on to a table. She developed difficulty in breathing and examination showed a swelling in the anterior part of the nasal septum. Next line of management is:
‘Griesinger sign’ is otalgia along with pain and edema over mastoid. It is typically seen in:
The current treatment of choice for a large antrochoanal polyp in a 30-year- old man is:

A 16-year-old male presents with a history of recurrent epistaxis (nosebleeds) and nasal obstruction on the right side. On examination, a highly vascular mass is visualized in the right nasal cavity. CT imaging reveals a soft tissue lesion centered in the pterygopalatine fossa, extending into the nasopharynx. The patient has no significant medical history. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Danger space is located between:

options.label: A
options.text: Capsule of tonsil and superior constrictor muscle

questions.correct_answer: B. Alar fascia and prevertebral fascia

questions.text: Most common cause for bilateral Recurrent laryngeal Nerve paralysis:

A 45-year-old male presents to the ophthalmology clinic with complaints of double vision. On examination, his left eye shows a significant limitation of abduction. All other extraocular movements are intact. Which of the following muscles is most likely affected in this patient?

A 62-year-old patient presents to the ophthalmology clinic with complaints of gradually progressive loss of vision in both eyes over the past 6 months. Intraocular pressure (IOP) measurements are found to be elevated in both eyes. On examination, the patient has cupping of the optic discs, with a vertical cup-to-disc ratio of 0.8. Visual field testing reveals peripheral visual field loss in both eyes. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The most common method of anterior capsulotomy in phaco- emulsification:
Thinnest portion of sclera:
questions.correct_answer: B. Posterior to rectus muscle insertion

questions.text: Female presents with galactorrhoea and amenorrhea and diagnosed with Pituitary adenoma and now complains of loss of vision which will be?
Microaneurysms are hallmark lesions in which disease?

A 9-year-old child presents to the emergency department with complaints of fever, headache, and swelling around the left eye. On examination, there is proptosis, limitation of extraocular movements, and edema of the eyelids. The child is unable to open the left eye fully. There is also tenderness on palpation of the affected area. Visual acuity is decreased in the left eye. What is the most likely diagnosis?
“Pie in the sky” field defect is seen in lesion of:

A clinical condition seen in a 24 year old male is characterised by a facial palsy and is often associated with facial pain and the appearance of vesicles on the canal and pinna. Vertigo and sensor neural hearing loss (VIIIth nerve) accompanying it is suggestive of:
Nasolacrimal duct opens in:

A 64-year hypertensive obese female was undergoing surgery for fracture femur under general anaesthesia. Intraoperatively her end tidal CO2 volume decreased to 20 from 40 mmHg followed by hypotension and oxygen saturation of 85%. What could be the most probable cause?

A 6-year-old boy presents with a three-month history of intermittent right hip pain and a limp. On physical examination, there is limited range of motion in the right hip, especially with internal rotation. Radiographs of the hip reveal a flattened femoral head with sclerosis and fragmentation. Based on these findings, what is the most likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with a painful left forearm after falling from his bicycle. On examination, there is obvious deformity of the left elbow with swelling and tenderness. Radiographs reveal a proximal ulnar fracture with anterior dislocation of the radial head. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 7-year-old child presents to the emergency department with a swollen and painful right knee. The child is unable to bear weight on the affected leg and has a fever. On physical examination, there is warmth, tenderness, and limited range of motion in the right knee. The child has no history of recent trauma. What is the most likely diagnosis for the child’s current condition?

A 35-year-old male presents to the emergency department with severe pain and swelling in his right knee after a fall. On examination, there is tenderness, swelling, and a palpable gap over the patella. Radiographs reveal a transverse fracture of the patella with displacement. What is the most appropriate management for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Closed reduction and immobilization in a knee brace

options.label: B
options.text: Open reduction and internal fixation with tension band wiring

options.label: C
options.text: Non-operative management with a knee immobilizer and non-weight bearing

options.label: D
options.text: Arthroscopic debridement and loose body removal

questions.correct_answer: B. Open reduction and internal fixation with tension band wiring

questions.text: An elderly male with symptoms of sinusitis and an incidental finding in the skull. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A labourer’s second child is brought to the OPD with a swollen belly and dull face. He has been fed rice water (rice milk) in his diet mostly. On investigations, the child is found to have low serum protein and low albumin. What is the probable diagnosis?
A 3-year-old male has the following buccal mucosa finding. After three days, he presents to your OPD with a rash. What is your diagnosis?
A 3-year-old girl was brought by her mother with complaints of enlarged clitoris. Karyotype revealed 46XX. What is the likely cause?
A newborn is brought with evisceration of bowel loops from a defect in the abdominal wall to the right of the umbilicus. The most probable diagnosis is

A 6-month-old infant is brought to the clinic by his parents due to episodes of cyanosis that occur during crying and feeding. On examination, the infant appears well and has a grade 3/6 systolic murmur along the left sternal border. The liver edge is palpable 3 cm below the right costal margin. Radiological finding is as shown. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Contraceptive option available to a 28-year-old breastfeeding mother with 6 week old baby, wishing to avoid next pregnancy are the following except:
General fertility rate is a better measure of fertility in defining GFR , which of the following is taken as the denominator?

options.label: A
options.text: Mid year population between 15 to 49 years of age in the same year

options.label: B
options.text: Mid year women population between 15 to 49 years of age in the same year

options.label: C
options.text: Mid year married women between 15 to 49 years of age in the same year of age

options.label: D
options.text: Live births in the same year

questions.correct_answer: B. Mid year women population between 15 to 49 years of age in the same year

questions.text: Live attenuated vaccines are:
The physician recommends administering vaccines that are not sensitive to heat due to the environmental conditions. Which of the following is not heat sensitive vaccine?

In 1980, ICIDH (International Classification of Impairment, Disability and Handicap) was published by the WHO as a manual of classification relating to the consequences of disease. In an accident, a person lost his leg. According to ICIDH this is an example for:
“Web of causation of disease”, which statement is most appropriate?

options.label: B
options.text: Requires complete understanding of all factors associated with causation of disease

options.label: D
options.text: Helps to suggest ways to interrupt the risk of transmission

questions.correct_answer: D. Helps to suggest ways to interrupt the risk of transmission

questions.text: Continuous scrutiny of the factors that determine the occurrence and distribution of disease and others conditions of ill-health is known as surveillance. The National Health Program of India collects data for morbidity and mortality mainly by which type of surveillance?
An action which halts the progress of a disease at its incipient stage and prevents complications is called:
Which one of the following methods is used for the estimation of chlorine demand of water?
Setting up of condom vending machines at public places in high HIV prevalence areas is an example of:
The national health plan recommended one PHC for how many people in hilly and tribal areas:

A 27-year-old man presents to the ED with concerns of having a heart ailment. He says that he has been concerned about having a heart attack for the past 12 months. He constantly searches the Internet to read about symptoms associated with heart disease and survival rates of people having heart disease. He reports that his worry is causing him a great deal of stress and concern. Medical history is unremarkable. Family history is significant for a myocardial infarction in his father just over a year ago, who is currently living without significant morbidity. Vital signs, physical examination and a 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG) are all normal. Which of the following diagnoses fits best with the patient’s presentation?

A 19-year-old woman is brought to Emergency Department by her mother. Her mother is concerned that her daughter appears unwell. She tells the Physician that since coming home for the summer holidays, her daughter has not been herself. She barely eats and has lost a dramatic amount of weight. Questioning reveals that the patient has no history of fevers or night sweats. 2 Clinical examination reveals a young woman with a body mass index (BMI) of 16 kg/ m , who appears malnourished. She claims to have little to no appetite, and her mother confirms she has overheard her daughter vomiting regularly after each meal. Physical examination reveals cachexia, a fine lanugo on the patient's face, a patchy, irregular alopecia across the back of her head and a firm but compressible mass in the left upper quadrant. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for her symptoms?

A 45-year-old man is referred with reduced energy levels, difficulty sleeping and low mood, symptoms he has been experiencing for several months. His wife divorced him last year on grounds of unreasonable behaviour, when he became withdrawn and refused to do anything around the house after losing his job. On further questioning, he also admits to hearing voices telling him that he is useless. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old man attends the Outpatient Clinic. He has no prior medical history. He is obsessed with washing his hands and spends up to one hour doing this each morning and evening. He says he feels that he is dirty. He is also concerned about security and checks the doors at home a number of times before leaving the house. On examination, he is in a low mood. He is slowed up in speech, but coherent. Which of the following is the first-line treatment option for this patient?

A 60-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with a chief complaint of believing that his wife has been replaced by an imposter. He claims that although she looks identical, she behaves differently and does not have the same emotional connection as his real wife. This delusional belief is limited to his wife and does not extend to other people. The patient has a history of a recent head injury. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male patient is brought to the emergency department following an uneventful appendectomy. In the postoperative period, the patient developed a rapid rise in body temperature, generalized muscle rigidity, tachycardia, and metabolic acidosis. His urine output is significantly decreased with shown capnography. The patient has a family history of adverse reactions to anesthesia. Which of the following is the drug of choice for management of the condition?
Which of the following nerves is popularly used in clinical anaesthesia to monitor neuromuscular blockade?
Identify the Mallampatti class of this patient.
What is the most effective circuit for anaesthesia under spontaneous breathing?
A 30-year-old male patient was intubated for surgery by a final-year resident. Which of the following is the best method to confirm the position of the endotracheal tube?
Which among the following is an example of epimers?

A 9-year old child presents chronic fatigue, growth retardation and epistaxis. On further evaluation, hepatosplenomegaly, thrombo- cytopenia and anemia was found. X-ray of the femur showed Erlenmeyer flask deformity. Bone marrow biopsy showed cells with wrinkled tissue paper appearance. What is the probable diagnosis?
A 23-year old woman is on chronic therapy with the anti-TB drug Isoniazid. Which of the following vitamin deficiencies can be seen in this individual?

A 41-year-old man, who is consuming jowar for a long duration, now presents with rashes in the sun- exposed area like dorsum of the hand, around the neck, as shown in the image below. Which is the vitamin deficient in this patient?
Which of the following is not an intermediate of the TCA?
The glycosaminoglycan present in the cornea is:
Pellagra-like symptoms can be due to all of the following except?
Which of the following is true about DNA organization in chromo- somes?

options.label: A
options.text: Centromere is an adenine-thymine (A-T)- rich region containing repeated DNA sequences

options.label: B
options.text: Telomeres consist of short TTAGGG-rich repeats

options.label: C
options.text: Each sister chromatid contains one dsDNA molecule

questions.correct_answer: A. Centromere is an adenine-thymine (A-T)- rich region containing repeated DNA sequences

questions.text: The parent purine nucleotide made from de novo purine synthesis is:
What is the end product of breakdown of purine nucleotides?
Which of the following enzymes catalyze the rate-limiting step of glycogenolysis?

A 6-year-old child presents with hyperuricemia and delayed developmental milestones. He also has the habit of biting his lips, fingers, and feet because of which he is always strapped to the bed. Urine examined showed orange sands. Which is the most probable enzyme deficiency?
